section.p: The template is based on the Clincial Event domain. It captures clinical events of interest that are not classified as adverse events. The data for a clinical event may include information about episodes of symptoms of the disease under study (often known as signs and symptoms), or about events that do not constitute adverse events in themselves, though they might lead to the identification of an adverse event. For example, in a study of an investigational treatment for migraine headaches, migraine headaches may not be considered to be adverse events per protocol. The occurrence of migraines or associated signs and symptoms might be reported as a clinical event. Other studies might track the occurrence of specific events as efficacy endpoints. For example, in a study of an investigational treatment for prevention of ischemic stroke, all occurrences of TIA, stroke and death might be captured as clinical events and assessed as to whether they meet endpoint criteria.

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass) (CONF:458)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood) (CONF:459)

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:460)/@code="CEtbd" (CONF:1529)
The code value indicates that this observation records a clinical event.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime (CONF:462)
The start and stop date/times of the clinical event. The high and low properties of the IVL_TS type are used to capture the start and stop date/times of the event. [SDTM: CESTDTC, CEENDTC]

SHALL contain [1..3] id (CONF:463)
A value that is provided to ensure the uniqueness of clincal event items. [SDTM: CESEQ, CEREFID, CESPID] A single identifier, the sequence number, is required.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode (CONF:464), where the @code SHALL be selected from (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 ActStatus) (CONF:1530)
Used to indicate whether the activity - occurrence of the clinical event - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the event occurred. [SDTM: CEOCCUR]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CD (CONF:465), where the @code SHALL be selected from ValueSet Clinical Event locally defined STATIC (CONF:1531)
A code value and descriptive text to provide information on the nature of the clinical event. Use the original text property of the CD type to capture the verbatim tem for the event. [SDTM: CETERM, CEDECOD]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] entryRelationship (CONF:466)
Identifies the SDTM or SEND domain the record is assigned to.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Domain Assignment (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.30)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:467)
Carries information regarding the timing of data collection related to the clinical event.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Data Collection (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.27)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:468)
Indicates whether or not the event was prespecified on the CRF.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Pre-Specified Event (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.70)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:469)
Information on the reason the clinical event was not carried out.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.56)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:470)
Indicates the body system or organ class associated with the clinical event.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Body System or Organ Class (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.17)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:471)
Captures information about the severity of the clinical event.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Event or Finding Severity (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.34)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:472)
Allows positioning of the start of the event with relationship to a defined reference time period.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Start Relative to Reference Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.79)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:473)
Allows positioning of the termination of the event with relationship to a defined reference time period.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Stop Relative to Reference Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.80)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:474)
The record of a category to be used in organizing information items.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Category (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.20)

Contains zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
The record of a sub-category to be used in organizing information items.
Contains exactly one [1..1] Sub- Category (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.91)

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:475)
Establishes a relationship between this record and another record.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Related Record (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.75)

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:476)
Allows the association of a supplemental value - outside of the content specfied for the domain - to the record.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Supplemental Value (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.96)

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:477)
A place to insert comments related to a particular finding.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Comment (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.23)

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:478)
Allows recording of additional findings related to the event.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Finding About (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.40)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass) (CONF:458)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood) (CONF:459)

SHALL contain [1..3] id (CONF:463)
A value that is provided to ensure the uniqueness of clincal event items. [SDTM: CESEQ, CEREFID, CESPID] A single identifier, the sequence number, is required.

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:460)/@code="CEtbd" (CONF:1529)
The code value indicates that this observation records a clinical event.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode (CONF:464), where the @code SHALL be selected from (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 ActStatus) (CONF:1530)
Used to indicate whether the activity - occurrence of the clinical event - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the event occurred. [SDTM: CEOCCUR]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime (CONF:462)
The start and stop date/times of the clinical event. The high and low properties of the IVL_TS type are used to capture the start and stop date/times of the event. [SDTM: CESTDTC, CEENDTC]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with data type CD (CONF:465), where the @code SHALL be selected from ValueSet Clinical Event locally defined STATIC (CONF:1531)
A code value and descriptive text to provide information on the nature of the clinical event. Use the original text property of the CD type to capture the verbatim tem for the event. [SDTM: CETERM, CEDECOD]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] entryRelationship (CONF:466)
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Domain Assignment (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.30)
Identifies the SDTM or SEND domain the record is assigned to.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:467)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Data Collection (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.27)
Carries information regarding the timing of data collection related to the clinical event.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:468)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Pre-Specified Event (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.70)
Indicates whether or not the event was prespecified on the CRF.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:469)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.56)
Information on the reason the clinical event was not carried out.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:470)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Body System or Organ Class (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.17)
Indicates the body system or organ class associated with the clinical event.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:471)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Event or Finding Severity (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.34)
Captures information about the severity of the clinical event.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:472)
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Start Relative to Reference Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.79)
Allows positioning of the start of the event with relationship to a defined reference time period.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:473)
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Stop Relative to Reference Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.80)
Allows positioning of the termination of the event with relationship to a defined reference time period.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF:474)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Category (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.20)
The record of a category to be used in organizing information items.

Contains zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains exactly one [1..1] Sub- Category (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.91)
The record of a sub-category to be used in organizing information items.

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:475)
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Related Record (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.75)
Establishes a relationship between this record and another record.

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:476)
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Supplemental Value (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.96)

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship (CONF:477)

Contains exactly one [1..1] Comment (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.23)
